lines.content: {Describe the design and implementation of the product. Use UML diagrams and short code snippets where applicable.}
{Describe the value proposition: what problem does it solve?}
|Version| As a ... | I want to ...                    | So that I can ...                            |
|v1.0|user| add movies to a list             | keep track of which movies I have watched.   |
|v1.0|user| add ratings out of 10 to a movie | remember how much I enjoyed the movie.       |
|v1.0|user| remove movies from my list       | delete erroneous entries.                    |
|v1.0|user| list the movies I have added       | view what movies I have watched              |
|v1.0|user| enter the date I watched the movie       | recall when I watched the movie.             |
|v2.0|user| arrange my review list by worst or best ratings        | see the shows that I like or hate the most.  |
|v2.0|user| star/favorite a movie        | mark shows that I would like to watch again. |
|v2.0|user| display a list that displays starred movies and shows        | view which are my favorites.|
{Give instructions on how to do a manual product testing e.g., how to load sample data to be used for testing}
+void Movie(title: String, rating: Double, genre: String,
+void TvShow(title: String, rating: Double, genre: String,
Duke is a movie review allowing you to keep track of movies you have watched!
1. Ensure that you have Java 11 or above installed.
2. Down the latest version of `Duke` from [here](https://github.com/AY2223S1-CS2113-T18-1/tp/releases/tag/v1.0).
3. Copy the jar file into the folder you want to store your reviews.
4. Open terminal application and change directory to the above folder
5. Run the jar file by entering java -jar tp.jar into the terminal.
The following features are supported by Duke.
Adds a new movie review to your list.
Displays all movies you have reviewed.
Removes a movie review from your list.
Deletes all movie reviews in your list.
return "\tGot it. I've added the following item to the list:\n\t" + media.toString()
+ "\n\n\tNow you have " + reviewList.inputs.size() + " reviews in the list.";
